verses.roman:
kruddha hañā tāṅre kichu cāhe balibāre
āpani pratāparudra nivārila tāre

synonyms: kruddha hañā—becoming angry; tāṅre—unto Śrīvāsa Ṭhākura; kichu—something; cāhe—wants; balibāre—to speak; āpani—personally; pratāparudra—King Pratāparudra; nivārila—stopped; tāre—unto him.
translation: As the angered Haricandana was about to speak to Śrīvāsa Ṭhākura, Pratāparudra Mahārāja personally stopped him.
